definition: Michael Schumacher (1969-), former German racing driver
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)

sentences.english: Willi Weber, manager of Michael Schumacher.
sentences.chinese: 威利韋伯，經理邁克爾舒馬赫。

sentences.english: Even at the age of 36, Schumacher is not ready to allow his crown to slip.
sentences.chinese: 即便已年屆36歲，舒馬赫尚不準備讓其王冠旁落。

sentences.english: Schumacher was wearing a helmet when he fell and hit his head against a rock, his manager Sabine Kehm said.
sentences.chinese: 他的經理人稱，舒馬赫頭部碰撞到岩石時帶着頭盔。

sentences.english: On Saturday he was visited by Michael Schumacher and Jean Todt.
sentences.chinese: 在週六時大舒馬赫和託德看望過他。

sentences.english: Someone bets that in Ferrari you will become more popular than Sch.
sentences.chinese: 有人打賭說在法拉利你會比舒馬赫更受歡迎。

sentences.english: With only the season ending Japanese Grand Prix remaining, Formula one rivals Schumacher and Hakkinen have been testing.
sentences.chinese: 一級方程式競爭對手舒馬赫和哈基寧已經開始試車了。

sentences.english: This was the lone victory of Schumacher in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 這是舒馬赫在2005年的唯一一次勝利。
